description: Settlement area in the northern part of Durobrivae, characterised as a 'suburb' but with evidence for much industrial activity. A circular building with tessellated flooring was built at the beginning of the 3rd CE and has been identified as a shrine.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Water Newton, Normangate Field (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Perrin. “Roman Pottery from Excavations at and near to the Roman Small Town of Durobrivae, Water Newton, Cambridgeshire, 1956-58.” Journal of Roman Pottery Studies 8 (1999).
